eapli.framework.domain

Class RomanNumeral

  • java.lang.Object
    • eapli.framework.domain.RomanNumeral

  • public class RomanNumeral
extends Object
    This code is based on http://math.hws.edu/eck/cs124/javanotes6/c8/ex3-ans.html An object of type RomanNumeral is an integer between 1 and 3999. It can be constructed either from an integer or from a string that represents a Roman numeral in this range. The function toString() will return a standardized Roman numeral representation of the number. The function toInt() will return the number as a value of type int.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RomanNumeral

        public RomanNumeral(int arabic)
        Constructor. Creates the Roman number with the int value specified by the parameter. Throws a NumberFormatException if arabic is not in the range 1 to 3999 inclusive.
        Parameters:
        arabic - the number we want to express as a Roman literal
